conclusion: The radius R of the circular path in a magnetic field is determined using the formula R = mv/qB.
The velocity v of the particle as it enters the magnetic field is sqrt(2qU/m).
Substituting the velocity into the formula for the radius of curvature gives R = sqrt(2qU)/B.
The radius R of the circular path of the particle in the magnetic field is sqrt(2qU)/B.
